remarks: An order isomorphism is a homeomorphism on the respective order topologies.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
statement:
ordthmeo.1 $e |- X = dom R $.
ordthmeo.2 $e |- Y = dom S $.
ordthmeo $p |- ( ( R e. V /\ S e. W /\ F Isom R , S ( X , Y ) ) -> F e. ( ( ordTop ` R ) Homeo ( ordTop ` S ) ) ) $.
